intro: Hieracium glabratiforme, commonly known as the smoothleaf hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually smooth and lance-shaped, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Hieracium glabratiforme is often considered a weed but can be found in various habitats across its native range.
